In all complex conflicts (ones that don't just involve the party beating the adversaries down) there will usually be a goal which the party wants to achieve. These can be done in the following ways:

  • Opposing Clocks: Consists of two clocks. One to be filled by the party to interrupt the adversaries objective or complete it before them. Another for the adversaries to complete their objective.

  • Contested Clock: A clock that the adversaries are advancing which the party is trying to turn back.

Advancing or turning back clocks requires the use of the Objective action.
